title: Dynamics Arrays of `Enum` are no longer allowed

labels.name: bug - type 0
labels.description: compiler halts or panics instead of generating code

body:
### Version Information

* vyper Version (output of `vyper --version`): 0.3.8+commit.1cd6f3db
* OS: OSX
* Python Version (output of `python --version`): 3.8.0

### What's your issue about?

In `v0.3.7`, Static Arrays of Enums were not allowed but Dynamics arrays could contain `Enum` types.
However, Dynamics Arrays of `Enum` are no longer allowed after #3156. 
```Vyper
enum Foo:
    a
bar: DynArray[Foo, 10]
```
Result of compilation with commit 1cd6f3db (with `v0.3.7`, it would compile succesfully) :

### How can it be fixed?

If the intention is to keep the v0.3.7 semantics, my guess would be to implement a similar carveout as the one done for arrays of bytestrings since `Enum` does not have the `_as_array` field.
https://github.com/vyperlang/vyper/blob/1cd6f3db7e06ed97ffd9eefb9cfc67506e461544/vyper/semantics/types/bytestrings.py#L29-L31
should we allow static arrays of enums though?

> should we allow static arrays of enums though?

It would be a good idea imo as it would be consistent with the other 1-word representable types
